Page._content: #### Alazia ![avatar](../images/aboutme.gif) ``` male 21 178 cm secret kg KM enthusiasts and pseudo-intellectual. ``` the CZO of Bankrupting Co.,Ltd and the brain of The Institute of Human Brain. Numerous hobbies,include classical music,opera,philosophy,logic,psychology,art,tarot,chess,anime,network security etc. like to share and `drink`

Post.title: Git
Post._content: ##### Git? - 1 - 2 Def`distributed` Version Control System(VCS) for tracking changes in computer files - 3 His:    Linus->Linux (1991)diff+Linus:CVS\SVN,    2002BitKeeper(BitMover)Linux    2005Andrew(Samba)BitKeeper    Linus->Git(by C) in two weeks    2008:GitHub ##### Install - 1 win: https://git-scm.com/download/win ##### Basic commands ``` $ git init // initialize Local Git Repository $ git add // Add File(s) To Index $ git status // Check Status of Working Tree $ git commit // Commit Changes In Index $ git push //Push to Remote Repository $ git pull //Pull Latest From Remote Repository $ git clone //clone Repository into a new Directory ``` ##### Use ###### 1.init - 1 Def repository:Git(`Changes`) - 2 Use: ``` $ mkdir myres // $ cd myres // $ git init //(Git) Initialized empty Git repository in ../myres/.git ``` ###### 2.addcommit - 1 Def **add**: (Index/stage) **commit**: (stage) **rm**: ![s](TL01/stage.png) - 2 Use: readme.md ``` $ git add readme.md // stage*all $ git commit -m "add readme" // -m:message res [master (root-commit) 99ae527] add readme 1 file changed, 0 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-) create mode 100644 readme.md ``` `file changed` `insertions` `deletions` ###### 3.statusdiff - 1 Def **status**: **diff**: [diffadd] **checkout - -reset HEAD** () - 2 Use readme.md: Git is a distributed version control system **2.1.** ``` $ git status On branch master Changes not staged for commit: (use "git add ..." to update what will be committed) (use "git checkout -- ..." to discard changes in working directory) modified: readme.md no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a") ``` readmeadd`checkout --` **2.2.** ``` $ git diff readme.md diff --git a/readme.md b/readme.md index e69de29..45e43ab 100644 --- a/readme.md +++ b/readme.md @@ -0,0 +1 @@ +Git is a distributed version control system \ No newline at end of file ``` **2.3.add** ``` $ git add * $ git status On branch master Changes to be committed: (use "git reset HEAD ..." to unstage) modified: readme.md ``` status readme.md`reset HEAD ` **2.4.commit** ``` $ git commit -m "add distributed" [master 51e675a] add distributed 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+) $ git status On branch master nothing to commit, working tree clean ``` status working tree clean ###### 4.logresetreflog - 1 Def: **log**: **reset**: () **reflog**: - 2 Use: 1add distributed ``` Git is a distributed version control system. ``` 2add free ``` Git is a distributed version control system. Git is free softwave. ``` 3append GPL ``` Git is a distributed version control system. Git is free softwave distributed under the GPL. ``` **2.1.** ``` $ git log commit 092719a05ea5929fb2a72c990ae3a38a5b0b8129 (HEAD -> master) Author: alazia Date: Sun Aug 4 17:54:32 2019 +0800 append GPL commit 8a74499d95b927245debf21afadf001e621cb948 Author: alazia Date: Sun Aug 4 17:53:14 2019 +0800 add free commit 51e675ad6e4a906bd4de3c65ef830b9564864ca4 Author: alazia Date: Sun Aug 4 17:39:11 2019 +0800 add distributed ``` log 3append GPLadd freeadd distributed - -pretty=oneline ``` $ git log --pretty=oneline 092719a05ea5929fb2a72c990ae3a38a5b0b8129 (HEAD -> master) append GPL 8a74499d95b927245debf21afadf001e621cb948 add free 51e675ad6e4a906bd4de3c65ef830b9564864ca4 add distributed ``` gitSHA1`commit id` **2.2.** HEAD HEAD^NHEAD~N append GPL add free ``` $ git reset --hard HEAD^ //commit id HEAD is now at 8a74499 add free $ cat readme.md Git is a distributed version control system. Git is free softwave ``` **2.3.** ``` $ git log commit 8a74499d95b927245debf21afadf001e621cb948 (HEAD -> master) Author: alazia Date: Sun Aug 4 17:53:14 2019 +0800 add free commit 51e675ad6e4a906bd4de3c65ef830b9564864ca4 Author: alazia Date: Sun Aug 4 17:39:11 2019 +0800 add distributed commit 99ae527b16c7a4fe17c77f383b4bdba54a5f5ceb Author: alazia Date: Sun Aug 4 16:56:38 2019 +0800 add readme ``` git ,reset ``` $ git reflog 8a74499 (HEAD -> master) HEAD@{0}: reset: moving to HEAD^ 092719a HEAD@{1}: commit: append GPL 8a74499 (HEAD -> master) HEAD@{2}: commit: add free 51e675a HEAD@{3}: commit: add distributed $ git reset --hard 092719a HEAD is now at 092719a append GPL ``` ##### remote ###### 1.SSH Key - 1 SSH Key ``` $ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "youremail@example.com" ``` `.ssh`, `id_rsa` `id_rsa.pub` - 2 SSH Key Github->Account Settings->SSH Keys->Add SSH Key id_rsa.pubTitle ![SSHKEY](TL01/SSHkey.png) - Github SSH Key GitHub(Push)GitSSHSSH Key ###### 2. - 1 myresGithub **** Github **** Github ``` $ git remote add origin git@github.com:username/resname.git // origin git ``` Ps:SSH KEY/ **** ``` $ git push -u origin master Counting objects: 20, done. Delta compression using up to 4 threads. Compressing objects: 100% (15/15), done. Writing objects: 100% (20/20), 1.64 KiB | 560.00 KiB/s, done. Total 20 (delta 5), reused 0 (delta 0) remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (5/5), done. To github.com:username/resname.git * [new branch] master -> master Branch 'master' set up to track remote branch 'master' from 'origin'. ``` Ps:,`git push` master `-u`mastermastermastermaster - 2 Push **Def**: master****GitHub **Use**: ``` $ git push origin master ``` ###### 3. - 1 GitHub **** **** ``` $ git clone git@github.com:username/remotename.git Cloning into 'remotename'... remote: Counting objects: 3, done. remote: Total 3 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 3 Receiving objects: 100% (3/3), done. ``` Ps: 1.git:// ssh 2.https httphttpsssh - 2 Pull **Def**: GitHub **Use**: ``` $ git pull ``` ###### SSH - clone|pushGithub ``` The authenticity of host 'github.com (xx.xx.xx.xx)' can't be established. RSA key fingerprint is xx.xx.xx.xx.xx. Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? ``` GitSSHSSHGitHubKeyGitHubKeyGitHub`yes` GitGitHubKey ``` Warning: Permanently added 'github.com' (RSA) to the list of known hosts. ``` ##### Branch ###### 1.Def - - ###### 2. - 1.Def [](#001),,Git `master``HEAD``master`,`master` `HEAD`****. ![branch01](TL01/branch01.png) - 2.branch **dev** ``` $ git branch dev $ git checkout dev Switched to a new branch 'dev' ``` ``` $ git checkout -b dev Switched to a new branch 'dev' ``` git`dev``master``HEAD``dev````dev` ![branch02](TL01/branch02.png) **** `dev``dev` ![branch03](TL01/branch03.png) **dev** `dev``master``dev` ``` $ git checkout master //master,masterdev Switched to branch 'master' $ git merge dev //dev. Updating d46f35e..b17d20e Fast-forward readme.txt | 1 + 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+) ``` `Fast-forward`masterdev ![branch04](TL01/branch04.png) ``` $ git branch //* * dev master $ git branch -d dev //dev $ git branch * master ``` ![branch05](TL01/branch05.png) ###### 3. - 1 Def: **conflict** - 2 Solution: `feature1` readme.md ``` Creating a new branch is quick AND simple ``` ``` $ git add * $ git commit -m "AND" [feature1 c5584de] AND 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 2 deletions(-) ``` `master` readme.md ``` Creating a new branch is quick & simple ``` ``` $ git add * $ git commit -m "&" [master 59d6553] & 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 2 deletions(-) ``` `merge` ``` $ git merge feature1 Auto-merging readme.md CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in readme.md Automatic merge failed; fix conflicts and then commit the result. ``` Gitreadme.mdstatus ``` $ git status On branch master You have unmerged paths. (fix conflicts and run "git commit") (use "git merge --abort" to abort the merge) Unmerged paths: (use "git add ..." to mark resolution) both modified: readme.md no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a") ``` readme.md ``` <<<<<<< HEAD Creating a new branch is quick & simple ======= Creating a new branch is quick AND simple >>>>>>> feature1 ``` Git<<<<<<<=======>>>>>>> ``` Creating a new branch is quick AND simple ``` ``` $ git add readme.md $ git commit -m "conflict fixed" [master ec49478] conflict fixed ``` ![branch06](TL01/branch06.png) `log` ``` $ git log --graph --pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit //git log --graph * ec49478 (HEAD -> master) conflict fixed |\ | * c5584de (feature1) AND * | 59d6553 & |/ * 092719a append GPL * 8a74499 add free * 51e675a add distributed * 99ae527 add readme $ git branch -d feature1 // Deleted branch feature1 (was c5584de). ``` ###### 4. - 1 Def: (),Git`Fast forward` ![branch04](TL01/branch04.png) ![branch05](TL01/branch05.png) `Fast forward`Git`merge`commit ![branch06](TL01/branch06.png) - 2 Use:`--no-ff` ``` $ git merge --no-ff -m "merge with on-ff" dev Merge made by the 'recursive' strategy. readme.md | 2 +- 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-) $ git log --graph --pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit * f0fcabe (HEAD -> master) merge with no-ff |\ | * ee54c4c (dev) add merge |/ * ec49478 conflict fixed ``` - 3 master dev 1.0devmastermaster1.0 devdev ![Git](TL01/branch07.png) ###### BugFeature - 1 Bug Def: bug 404bug`issue-404``dev` ****`stash` ``` $ git stash Saved working directory and index state WIP on dev: f0fcabe merge with no-ff ``` **** bug ``` $ git checkout master Switched to branch 'master' $ git checkout -b issue-404 Switched to a new branch 'issue-404' ``` ****bug ``` $ git add * $ git commit -m "fix bug 404" [issue-404 d9abeeb] fix bug 404 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-) ``` ****bug ``` $ git checkout master Switched to branch 'master' $ git merge --no-ff -m "merged bug fix 404" issue-404 Merge made by the 'recursive' strategy. readme.md | 2 +- 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-) $ git branch -d issue-404 Deleted branch issue-404 (was d9abeeb). $ git checkout dev Switched to branch 'dev' $ git status On branch dev nothing to commit, working tree clean ``` ****`stash apply+drop /pop` ``` $ git stash list stash@{0}: WIP on dev: f0fcabe merge with no-ff $ git stash pop //stashapply stash@{0}drop stash@{0}: On branch dev Changes to be committed: (use "git reset HEAD ..." to unstage) new file: hello.py Changes not staged for commit: (use "git add ..." to update what will be committed) (use "git checkout -- ..." to discard changes in working directory) modified: readme.txt Dropped refs/stash@{0} (5d677e2ee266f39ea296182fb2354265b91b3b2a) $ git stash list // ``` - 2 feature Def: featurefeature ``` $ git branch -d feature-x error: The branch 'feature-x' is not fully merged. If you are sure you want to delete it, run 'git branch -D feature-x'. ``` `-D` ``` $ git branch -D feature-x Deleted branch feature-x (was 287773e). ``` ###### Rebase - 1 Def [remote](#002),Push()PUll() - 2 Remote ``` $ git remote -v origin git@github.com:username/resname.git (fetch) origin git@github.com:username/resname.git (push) ``` originpush - 3 Push ``` $ git push origin branch-name ``` `master` `dev` `bug`bug `feature` - 4 Pull/Clone `master``dev`,clone`master` `dev`origin/dev ``` $ git checkout -b dev origin/dev ``` `dev``dev` ``` $ git push origin dev To github.com:username/resname.git ! [rejected] dev -> dev (non-fast-forward) error: failed to push some refs to 'git@github.com:username/resname.git' hint: Updates were rejected because the tip of your current branch is behind hint: its remote counterpart. Integrate the remote changes (e.g. hint: 'git pull ...') before pushing again. hint: See the 'Note about fast-forwards' in 'git push --help' for details. ``` ````````: ``` $ git pull There is no tracking information for the current branch. Please specify which branch you want to merge with. See git-pull(1) for details. git pull If you wish to set tracking information for this branch you can do so with: git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/ dev ``` **devorigin/dev**: ``` $ git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/dev dev Branch 'dev' set up to track remote branch 'dev' from 'origin'. ``` Pull->merge->fix conflict->Push - 5 - git push origin branch-name - git pull - - git push origin branch-name - git pullno tracking informationgit branch --set-upstream-to branch-name origin/branch-name - 6 rebase Def: ,pushpullpush,Git`Rebase` Use: - Pushrebase rebasepush rebase ###### tag - 1 Def: tag - 2 Use: ``` $ git tag name //commit $ git tag name commit_id //logcommit, $ git tag // $ git show tagname //(id) $ git tag -a v0.1 -m "version 0.1 released" 1094adb $ git tag -d name // $ git push origin tagname // $ git push origin --tags // $ git tag -d v0.9 // $ git push origin :refs/tags/v0.9 push ``` commitcommitmasterdev ##### ###### Pull Request - TODO ###### Git - TODO - 1 [Git & GitHub Crash Course For Beginners](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SWYqp7iY_Tc) - 2 [Git](https://www.liaoxuefeng.com/wiki/896043488029600) - 3 [GIT](https://backlog.com/git-tutorial/cn/)

Integrate the remote changes (e.g. hint: 'git pull ...') before pushing again. hint: See the 'Note about fast-forwards' in 'git push --help' for details. ``` ````````: ``` $ git pull There is no tracking information for the current branch. Please specify which branch you want to merge with. See git-pull(1) for details. git pull If you wish to set tracking information for this branch you can do so with: git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/ dev ``` **devorigin/dev**: ``` $ git branch --set-upstream-to=origin/dev dev Branch 'dev' set up to track remote branch 'dev' from 'origin'. ``` Pull->merge->fix conflict->Push - 5 - git push origin branch-name - git pull - - git push origin branch-name - git pullno tracking informationgit branch --set-upstream-to branch-name origin/branch-name - 6 rebase Def: ,pushpullpush,Git`Rebase` Use: - Pushrebase rebasepush rebase ###### tag - 1 Def: tag - 2 Use: ``` $ git tag name //commit $ git tag name commit_id //logcommit, $ git tag // $ git show tagname //(id) $ git tag -a v0.1 -m "version 0.1 released" 1094adb $ git tag -d name // $ git push origin tagname // $ git push origin --tags // $ git tag -d v0.9 // $ git push origin :refs/tags/v0.9 push ``` commitcommitmasterdev ##### ###### Pull Request - TODO ###### Git - TODO - 1 [Git & GitHub Crash Course For Beginners](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SWYqp7iY_Tc) - 2 [Git](https://www.liaoxuefeng.com/wiki/896043488029600) - 3 [GIT](https://backlog.com/git-tutorial/cn/)

Post.title: Linuxwindows
Post._content: ##### Linux * ``` ls -lh ``` * R ``` ls -l|grep "^-"| wc -l ``` * R ``` ls -lR|grep "^-"| wc -l ``` * ``` ls -l *.wiff|grep "^-"| wc -l ls -l *.wiff.scan|grep "^-"| wc -l ls -l *blk*.wiff.scan|grep "^-"| wc -l ``` * ``` find . -type f -name "*GNHS*.wiff.scan" -exec ls -lh {} \; find . -type f -name "*GNHS*.wiff" ! -name "*blk*" -exec ls -lh {} \; # >out.logout.log find . -type f -name "*GNHS*.wiff.scan" -exec ls -lh {} \;>out.log ``` * .wiff_low.wiff ``` for var in *.wiff; do mv "$var" "${var%.wiff}_low.wiff"; done ``` ##### windows * python ``` import os import fnmatch import pandas as pd ``` * () ``` def formatSize(bytes): ''' mb ''' bytes = float(bytes) kb = bytes / 1024 mb = kb / 1024 return mb def search_text(search,path): ''' ''' res = [] size = [] for root, dirnames, filenames in os.walk(os.path.expanduser(path)): for extension in search: for filename in fnmatch.filter(filenames, extension): res.append(os.path.join(root,filename)) size.append(formatSize(os.path.getsize(os.path.join(root,filename)))) res_dict=dict(zip(res,size)) return res_dict w_search = ['*GNHS*.wiff*', '*GHNS*.wiff*'] w=search_text(w_search,'E:\') ``` * () = ``` def remove_text(a,b): ''' ''' # new=list(set(a) ^ set(b)) new=dict(a.items()-b.items()) return new df = pd.DataFrame(pd.Series(new), columns=['size']) df = df.reset_index().rename(columns={'index': 'filename'}) ``` * (BA) ``` '''DataFrame''' def check_diff(df1,df2): df1 = df1.append(df2) df1 = df1.append(df2) df1 = df1.drop_duplicates(subset=['filename'], keep=False) return df1 ``` * () ``` import os, sys def add_prefix_files(change,text): mark = change old_names = os.listdir( path ) for old_name in old_names: if old_name!= sys.argv[0]: if old_name.endswith(text): os.rename(os.path.join(path,old_name), os.path.join(path,mark+old_name[len(mark):])) print (old_name,"has been renamed successfully!\n New name is: ",mark+old_name[len(mark):]) In[0]:path='E:\' change='b23' text='.wiff' add_prefix_files(change,text) out[0]:b22_1.wiff has been renamed successfully! New name is:b23_1.wiff b22_2.wiff has been renamed successfully! New name is:b23_2.wiff '''os.path.join(path,mark+old_name)''' ```
Post.raw: --- title: Linuxwindows comments: True tags: - OS categories: - CODE --- ##### Linux * ``` ls -lh ``` * R ``` ls -l|grep "^-"| wc -l ``` * R ``` ls -lR|grep "^-"| wc -l ``` * ``` ls -l *.wiff|grep "^-"| wc -l ls -l *.wiff.scan|grep "^-"| wc -l ls -l *blk*.wiff.scan|grep "^-"| wc -l ``` * ``` find . -type f -name "*GNHS*.wiff.scan" -exec ls -lh {} \; find . -type f -name "*GNHS*.wiff" ! -name "*blk*" -exec ls -lh {} \; # >out.logout.log find . -type f -name "*GNHS*.wiff.scan" -exec ls -lh {} \;>out.log ``` * .wiff_low.wiff ``` for var in *.wiff; do mv "$var" "${var%.wiff}_low.wiff"; done ``` ##### windows * python ``` import os import fnmatch import pandas as pd ``` * () ``` def formatSize(bytes): ''' mb ''' bytes = float(bytes) kb = bytes / 1024 mb = kb / 1024 return mb def search_text(search,path): ''' ''' res = [] size = [] for root, dirnames, filenames in os.walk(os.path.expanduser(path)): for extension in search: for filename in fnmatch.filter(filenames, extension): res.append(os.path.join(root,filename)) size.append(formatSize(os.path.getsize(os.path.join(root,filename)))) res_dict=dict(zip(res,size)) return res_dict w_search = ['*GNHS*.wiff*', '*GHNS*.wiff*'] w=search_text(w_search,'E:\') ``` * () = ``` def remove_text(a,b): ''' ''' # new=list(set(a) ^ set(b)) new=dict(a.items()-b.items()) return new df = pd.DataFrame(pd.Series(new), columns=['size']) df = df.reset_index().rename(columns={'index': 'filename'}) ``` * (BA) ``` '''DataFrame''' def check_diff(df1,df2): df1 = df1.append(df2) df1 = df1.append(df2) df1 = df1.drop_duplicates(subset=['filename'], keep=False) return df1 ``` * () ``` import os, sys def add_prefix_files(change,text): mark = change old_names = os.listdir( path ) for old_name in old_names: if old_name!= sys.argv[0]: if old_name.endswith(text): os.rename(os.path.join(path,old_name), os.path.join(path,mark+old_name[len(mark):])) print (old_name,"has been renamed successfully!\n New name is: ",mark+old_name[len(mark):]) In[0]:path='E:\' change='b23' text='.wiff' add_prefix_files(change,text) out[0]:b22_1.wiff has been renamed successfully! New name is:b23_1.wiff b22_2.wiff has been renamed successfully! New name is:b23_2.wiff '''os.path.join(path,mark+old_name)''' ```

Post.title: Hexo workflow
Post._content:
##### preparation
- git, add `id_rsa.pub` to Deploy keys
| C:\Users\Administrator\.ssh\id_rsa.pub
- node.js:v12.8.0
- npm (mirror)

```
npm install -g hexo-cli
npm install ## package.json
npm install hexo-deploy-cli@x.x.x
```

##### workflow
```
git clone https://github.com/Alazia/Alazia.github.io.git
hexo new post
hexo clean
hexo g
gulp
hexo d
git add * (and .gitignore)
git commit -m 'source'
git push origin source
```
Post.raw:

title: Hexo workflow

##### preparation
- git, add `id_rsa.pub` to Deploy keys
| C:\Users\Administrator\.ssh\id_rsa.pub
- node.js:v12.8.0
- npm (mirror)

```
npm install -g hexo-cli
npm install ## package.json
npm install hexo-deploy-cli@x.x.x
```

##### workflow
```
git clone https://github.com/Alazia/Alazia.github.io.git
hexo new post
hexo clean
hexo g
gulp
hexo d
git add * (and .gitignore)
git commit -m 'source'
git push origin source
```
